TARGET: Winterthur Technologie AG 
BUYER: 3M Co. / 3M (Schweiz) AG 
SELLER: Winterthur Technologie AG



LAST UPDATE: May 31, 2011 
ANNOUNCE DATE: December 6, 2010 
EFFECTIVE DATE: May 20, 2011



DEAL NO.: 567762


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition Tender Offer

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

May 20, 2011

Attitude:

Friendly

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

3M (Schweiz) AG, a subsidiary of 3M Co, completed its tender offer to acquire Winterthur Technologie AG for CHF363.8 million (US$372.7 million) in cash. Under the terms of the offer, 3M (Schweiz) AG offered to pay CHF62 (US$63.5) per share of Winterthur Technologie AG. The acquisition would enhance and expand 3M Co's product line, as well as enable it to better serve its customer's needs for its industrial grinding and finishing business. On the other hand, the transaction would give Winterthur Technologie AG an international presence. Following the transaction, 3M Co intends to continue Winterthur Technologie AG's current production operations. The transaction was conditioned upon several conditions, including acceptances of 66.7% of Winterthur Technologie AG's total number of shares, receipt of all necessary approvals and other customary closing conditions. The deal was originally expected to be completed by the first quarter of 2011. The Board of Directors of Winterthur Technologie AG has recommended its shareholders to accept 3M Co's offer. In addition, Chairman of the Board Dr. Edgar Rappold has committed to tender his shares to 3M Co. Based in Winterthur, Switzerland, Winterthur Technologie AG manufactures and supplies industrial wheels for grinding, abrasion and cutting purposes with over 1,300 people. On February 8, 2011, 3M (Schweiz) AG currently has acceptances equivalent to a 27% stake in Winterthur Technologie AG. On February 11, 2011, 3M Co announced that it has waived the condition regarding the minimum acceptance level of 66.7%. The company has also declared the tender offer as successful, with acceptance level of 37%. The acceptance period was also extended from February 14 to February 25, 2011. On February 28, 2011, 3M Co announced that it has five million shares, equivalent to 85.3% of the issued shares of Winterthur Technologie AG at the end of its tender offer period on February 25, 2011. On April 25, 2011, Carborundum Universal Ltd, a major shareholder in Wendt India Ltd, has challenged 3M Co's indirect acquisition of 40% in Wendt India Ltd. Winterthur Technologie AG currently owns a 40% stake in Wendt India Ltd. According to Carborundum Universal Ltd, the indirect acquisition of 40% in Wendt India would breach the Foreign Direct Investment regulations in India. On May 20, 2011, 3M (Schweiz) AG has approximately a 97.1% stake in Winterthur Technologie AG. On the same day, 3M Co announced its intentions to delist Winterthur Technologie AG from the SIX Swiss Stock Exchange once they fully acquire the company. On May 30, 2011, 3M (Schweiz) AG has approximately more than 98% stake in Winterthur Technologie AG. The board of Winterthur Technologie recommends the squeeze-out of its remaining shares by 3M (Schweiz) with the offer price still at CHF62 (US$63.5).

Transaction Notes:

BE = CHF62 cash per share * 5,867,772 target shares o/s.

Premium Offered:

.138

Percent Sought:

100.000%

TARGET: E Wood Holdings PLC 
BUYER: 3M Co. / 3M UK Holdings PLC 
SELLER: E Wood Holdings PLC



LAST UPDATE: November 13, 2008 
ANNOUNCE DATE: March 22, 2007 
EFFECTIVE DATE: May 1, 2007



DEAL NO.: 415366


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition Tender Offer

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

May 1, 2007

Attitude:

Friendly

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

3M UK Holdings Plc, a subsidiary of 3M United Kingdom Plc and 3M Co, acquired through a tender offer E Wood Holdings Plc for GB£38.56 million (US$75.56 million) in cash. Under the terms of the agreement, 3M UK Holdings Plc will offer GB£3.23 (US$6.33) for every one EWD outstanding share. The offer will be funded by 3M Co's existing cash resources. 3M Co will retain the rights to any dividends declared or paid by E Wood Holdings Plc after the acquisition announcement. E Wood Holdings Plc manufactures specialty coatings for use in the gas, water, rail and automotive industries. The acquisition strengthens E Wood Holdings Plc's market presence and represents an excellent value for shareholders. 3M Co and E Wood Holdings Plc believe that E Wood Holdings Plc also offers a strong strategic fit through its expertise in coatings for pipes in oil, gas and water markets which is highly complementary to certain 3M Co operations. In addition to the terms of the offer, E Wood Holdings Plc agreed to pay an inducement fee of approximately GB£0.4 million (US$0.78 million) (plus VAT, if any, to the extent recoverable by E Wood) if the offer isn't complete due to certain undertakings. Upon the offer becoming or declared unconditional in all respects E Wood Holdings Plc will be cancelled from trading and de-listed from AIM of the London Stock Exchange. 3M UK Holdings Plc announced on 16 April 2007 that the offer has received valid acceptances in respect of approximately 86.34% of the issued share capital of E Wood Holdings Plc. The offer remains subject to the terms and conditions in the offer document. At this time, the offer has been extended and will remain open for acceptances until 1:00 pm. (UK) on 30 April 2007. The offer became unconditional as to acceptances on 20 April 2007. At this time, it was also announced that 3M UK Holdings Plc has received valid acceptances in respect of approximately 90.23% of E Wood Holdings Plc. The offer became wholly unconditional on 23 April 2007. The transaction was completed on 1 May 2007.

Transaction Notes:

BE = 11,937,915 EWD o/s * GB£3.23 cash per EWD o/s

Premium Offered:

0.417

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Share Price:

$6.457

TARGET: 3M Rochford Thompson Ltd. 
BUYER: 3M Co. 
SELLER: 3M Rochford Thompson Ltd.



LAST UPDATE: July 15, 2011 
ANNOUNCE DATE: July 12, 2007 
EFFECTIVE DATE: July 12, 2007



DEAL NO.: 430617


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

July 12, 2007

Deal Description:

3M Co acquired 3M Rochford Thompson Ltd for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition of 3M Rochford Thompson Ltd, which specialized in document scanning solutions, strengthened 3M Co's line of products for secure document capture and authentication and will enable it to expand into transportation markets such as international airlines.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

TARGET: Ceradyne, Inc. 
BUYER: 3M Co. 
SELLER: Ceradyne, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: November 20, 2013 
ANNOUNCE DATE: October 1, 2012 
EFFECTIVE DATE: November 28, 2012



DEAL NO.: 734412


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition Tender Offer

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Public Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

November 28, 2012

Attitude:

Friendly

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

3M Co acquired Ceradyne Inc for US$860.6 million in cash. Under the terms of the agreement, 3M Co purchased the entire share capital of Ceradyne Inc at a price of US$35 per share. The acquisition allowed 3M Co to expend its existing businesses. Following the transaction, Ceradyne Inc would operate as part of the 3M Energy and Advanced Materials Division of 3M Co. The deal was approved by the Board of Directors of Ceradyne Inc. The deal has been subject to the tender of a majority of the shares of Ceradyne Inc and other customary closing conditions. The deal was originally expected to close in the fourth quarter of 2012. Based in Costa Mesa, California, Ceradyne Inc develops, manufactures and markets advanced technical ceramic materials and products. On October 15, 2012, 3M Co announced that it commenced its tender offer. The offer expired on November 27, 2012. On November 16, 2012, the Austrian Federal Competition Authority approved the transaction. The transaction had already received approval from the German Federal Cartel Office on October 30, 2012. On November 28, 2012, 3M Co announced that it has acquired approximately 95.3% of Ceradyne Inc and exercised its top-up option and executed a short-form merger in order to acquire the remaining shares not tendered in the company at US$35 per share.

Transaction Notes:

BE = US$35 cash per share * 24,587,632 CRDN shares o/s.

Premium Offered:

.403

Percent Sought:

100.000%

$35.000000

Cash

Base Equity Price:

$860,567,120

$17,135,784

TARGET: Sumitomo 3M Ltd 
BUYER: 3M Co. 
SELLER: NEC Corp.



LAST UPDATE: January 13, 2004 
ANNOUNCE DATE: January 7, 2003 
EFFECTIVE DATE: March 31, 2003



DEAL NO.: 187886


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

March 31, 2003

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

3M Co acquired an additional 25% interest in Sumitomo 3M Ltd owned by NEC Corp for ¥45 billion (US $379.2 million) in cash. 3M Co will own a total of 75% of Sumitomo 3M Ltd. Sumitomo Electric Industries Ltd would own the remaining 25% of Sumitomo 3M Ltd.

TARGET: Energy, Inc. (South Carolina) 
BUYER: 3M Co. / 3M New Ventures 
SELLER: Energy, Inc. (South Carolina)



LAST UPDATE: January 18, 2010 
ANNOUNCE DATE: January 15, 2010 
EFFECTIVE DATE: January 15, 2010



DEAL NO.: 533656


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture Minority Interest

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

January 15, 2010

Deal Description:

3M New Ventures, a subsidiary of 3M Co, acquired an undisclosed minority interest in Energy Inc (South Carolina) for an undisclosed amount. The transaction gives Energy access to one of the most research resources in the world. Also, 3M's strategic shareholding will drive innovative business concepts with high commercialization potential for 3M and enables 3M to offer complementary products for energy consumption management as an innovative total package. Energy Inc, located in South Carolina, distributes The Energy Detective, a device that allows real-time residential energy data to be viewed remotely via the Internet.

Percent Sought:

-1.000%

DEAL NO.: 533656


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture Minority Interest

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

January 15, 2010

Deal Description:

3M New Ventures, a subsidiary of 3M Co, acquired an undisclosed minority interest in Energy Inc (South Carolina) for an undisclosed amount. The transaction gives Energy access to one of the most research resources in the world. Also, 3M's strategic shareholding will drive innovative business concepts with high commercialization potential for 3M and enables 3M to offer complementary products for energy consumption management as an innovative total package. Energy Inc, located in South Carolina, distributes The Energy Detective, a device that allows real-time residential energy data to be viewed remotely via the Internet.

TARGET: Polypore International, Inc. /Separations Media Bus/ 
BUYER: 3M Co. 
SELLER: Polypore International, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: October 17, 2015 
ANNOUNCE DATE: February 23, 2015 
EFFECTIVE DATE: August 26, 2015



DEAL NO.: 818233


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

August 26, 2015

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

3M Co acquired the business and assets of the Separations Media business of Polypore International Inc for US$1 billion in cash. 3M Co will finance the transaction with cash, the majority of which will come from outside the United States. The acquisition will add technology capabilities to complement 3M Co's existing filtration business in life sciences, industrial, water treatment, electronics and foodservice. Polypore International Inc operates two businesses: Energy Storage and Separations Media. Concurrently, Asahi Kasei Corp also entered into a definitive merger agreement to acquire Polypore International Inc, which consists of the remaining Energy Storage business following the 3M-Polypore deal. The transactions were approved by the Boards of Directors of Asahi Kasei Corp, 3M Co, and Polypore International Inc, and were subject to customary conditions, including approval of Polypore's shareholders and receipt of applicable regulatory clearances. Additionally, both deals are conditioned on 3M Co's transaction with Polypore closing immediately prior to the closing of Asahi Kasei Corp's transaction with Polypore International Inc. On August 19, Polypore International Inc and Asahi Kasei Corp 3M Co received antitrust clearance from the Fair Trade Commission of the Republic of Korea, which marks the final antitrust clearance required for the transactions. The deals are expected to close on August 26, 2015. On May 12, 2015, the Austrian competition authority approved the transaction. Polypore International Inc's Separations Media business manufactures microporous membranes and modules for filtration. It has 12-month sales of US$210 million as of September 27, 2014.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Original Offer Price:

$1,000,000,000

Closing Offer Price:

$1,000,000,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$1,000,000,000

Total Invested Capital:

$1,000,000,000

Base Equity Price:

$1,000,000,000

Seller Breakup Fee:

$16,750,000


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

Polypore International, Inc. /Separations Media Bus/

Country:

United States

Exchange:

New York Stock Exchange

Industry:

Chemicals, Paints & Coatings

Description:

Manufactures microporous membranes and modules for filtration

TARGET: 3M Co. /Asia Pacific Pharmceutical Business/ 
BUYER: 3M Co. Asia Pacific Pharma Business /Private Group/ 
SELLER: 3M Co.



LAST UPDATE: July 2, 2007 
ANNOUNCE DATE: November 9, 2006 
EFFECTIVE DATE: December 5, 2006



DEAL NO.: 398034


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture. Leveraged buyout.

Transaction Type:

Divestiture - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Financial

Closing Date:

December 5, 2006

Deal Description:

Australian private equity firms Ironbridge Capital and Archer Capital completed the acquisition of the assets and activities of 3M's pharmaceutical business in the Asia Pacific region, including Australia and South Africa for US$349 million. 3M is also selling its pharmaceutical businesses in the US, Canada and Latin American regions to Graceway Pharmaceuticals Inc for US$875 million and its pharmaceutical businesses in Europe to Meda AB for US$857 million. 3M's Health Care business recorded approximately US$3.76 billion and operating income of US$1.114 billion in 2005.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

$349,000,000

Closing Offer Price:

$349,000,000

Terms:

$349,000,000

Base Equity Price:

$349,000,000

TARGET: Financière Burgienne SAS 
BUYER: 3M Co. / 3M France 
SELLER: Financière Burgienne SAS



LAST UPDATE: December 2, 2008 
ANNOUNCE DATE: October 13, 2008 
EFFECTIVE DATE: December 1, 2008



DEAL NO.: 493859


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Conglomerate

Closing Date:

December 1, 2008

Deal Description:

3M France, ultimately owned by 3M Co, acquired Financire Burgienne SAS from Fonds Partenaires-Gestion SA for an undisclosed amount. Financire Burgienne SAS is a provider of finished license plates under the FAAB and FABRICAUTO brands in France. "The addition of FAAB and FABRICAUTO broadens 3M's vehicle registration solutions offering beyond reflective sheeting to finished license plates in France," said Larry Lair, vice president and general manager, 3M Traffic Safety Systems. Financire Burgienne SAS produces 20 million license plates a year at its two manufacturing facilities, in Bourg-en-Bresse and in Maccon. Financire Burgienne SAS employs 210 persons.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

Name:

Financière Burgienne SAS

Country:

France

Industry:

Description:

Provides finished license plates

DEAL NO.: 393140


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition Tender Offer

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Closing Date:

November 28, 2006

Attitude:

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

3M UK Holdings Plc, a subsidiary of 3M United Kingdom Plc itself a unit of 3M Co, completed its tender offer to acquire UK leading technology firm Biotrace International Plc for a cash consideration of GBP51.0 million (US$95.7 million). Biotrace manufactures, markets, and sells a range of systems comprising instruments and reagent kits. Biotrace compliments 3M product range and is a strong fit in providing hygiene monitoring and microbiological test to the food, beverage and dairy sectors.

Transaction Notes:

BE = GBP1.3 cash per share * 39,252,628 target shares o/s. Update: W.I.

TARGET: Cogent, Inc. 
BUYER: 3M Co. 
SELLER: Cogent, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: June 6, 2011 
ANNOUNCE DATE: August 30, 2010 
EFFECTIVE DATE: December 1, 2010



DEAL NO.: 557099


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition Tender Offer

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Public Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

December 1, 2010

Attitude:

Neutral

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

3M Co acquired Cogent Inc through a tender offer for US$930.5 million in cash. Under the terms of the agreement, Cogent Inc shareholders received US$10.50 for each outstanding share which is a 17.8% premium on the close price ending August 27, 2010. Cogent Inc is a provider of automated fingerprint and palm print identification systems. On October 6, 2010, Cogent announced that the Delaware Chancery Court denied a shareholder motion to block 3M's acquisition. On October 8, 2010, 3M Co tendered approximately 52% of the outstanding shares of Cogent Inc. 3M Co also extended the offer period for the remaining shares the company has not tendered in Cogent on October 22, 2010. 3M extended its offer for Cogent to October 26, 2010. On October 27, 2010, 3M Co tendered approximately 72.1% of the outstanding shares of Cogent Inc.

Transaction Notes:

BE = US$10.5 cash * 88,840,932 o/s of COGT 8/5/2010

TARGET: 3M Co. /Pressurized Polyurethane Foam Adhesives Bus/ 
BUYER: Innovative Chemical Products Group 
SELLER: 3M Co.



LAST UPDATE: February 3, 2016 
ANNOUNCE DATE: January 20, 2016 
EFFECTIVE DATE: February 1, 2016



DEAL NO.: 856063


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

February 1, 2016

Deal Description:

Innovative Chemical Products Group, a portfolio company of Audax Private Equity, acquired the Pressurized Polyurethane Foam Adhesives business of 3M Co for an undisclosed amount. The transaction would expand Innovative Chemical Products Group's market, technology and customer base. The acquisition would allow 3M Co to focus on its core adhesives, sealants and tapes businesses. Following the transaction, all 20 employees of 3M Co's Pressurized Polyurethane Foam Adhesives business would join Innovative Chemical Products Group. The transaction was subject to customary closing conditions and it was originally expected to close during the first quarter of 2016. The Pressurized Polyurethane Foam Adhesives business of 3M Co is located in the United States and manufactures polyurethane foam adhesives for residential and commercial roofing. It has sales of US$20 million for the year 2015.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

3M Co. /Pressurized Polyurethane Foam Adhesives Bus/

Country:

United States

Exchange:

New York Stock Exchange

Industry:

Chemicals, Paints & Coatings

Description:

Manufactures polyurethane foam adhesives for residential and commercial roofing

TARGET: 3M Co. /European Pharmaceutical Unit/ 
BUYER: Meda AB 
SELLER: 3M Co.



LAST UPDATE: October 23, 2007 
ANNOUNCE DATE: November 9, 2006 
EFFECTIVE DATE: January 2, 2007



DEAL NO.: 398032


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

January 2, 2007

Deal Description:

European specialty pharmaceutical company Meda AB acquired the assets and activities of 3M's pharmaceutical business in Europe for approximately GBP450.4 million (US$857 million). Concurrently, 3M is also divesting its pharmaceutical businesses in the US, Canada and Latin American regions to Graceway Pharmaceuticals Inc for GBP 459.8 million (US$875 million) and its pharmaceutical businesses in Asia Pacific to Ironbridge Capital and Archer Capital for GBP 183.3 million (US$349 million). 3M's Health Care business generated 2005 net sales of approximately GPB 2.0 billion (US$3.8 billion) and operating income of about GBP 585 million (US$1.1 billion). There are approximately 1,050 employees in 3M's pharmaceutical business worldwide. As of 04 January 2006, the acquisition has been approved by all the relevant competition authorities.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Original Offer Price:

$855,154,000

Closing Offer Price:

$875,688,000

Terms:

Available

Total Invested Capital:

$875,688,000

Base Equity Price:

$875,688,000

TARGET: Ait Advanced Information Technologies Corporation 
BUYER: 3M Co. / 3M Canada Co 
SELLER: Ait Advanced Information Technologies Corporation



LAST UPDATE: February 10, 2003 
ANNOUNCE DATE: May 23, 2002 
EFFECTIVE DATE: July 19, 2002



DEAL NO.: 170606


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

July 19, 2002

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

3M Canada Co, a subsidiary of Minnesota Mining & Manufacturing Co, acquired AIT Advanced Information Technologies Corp for CDN$37.6 million in cash. Under terms of the agreement, 3M Canada offered CDN$2.88 in cash per AIT Advanced share. AIT Advanced Information Technology Corp designs, manufactures, and markest electronic systems for personal identification. The Company provides software and system solutions for the issuance and management of secure documents, such as passports and visas. 3M conducts operations in electronics, telecommunications, industrial, consumer and office, health care, safety and other markets. Its businesses share technologies, manufacturing operations, brands, marketing channels and other resources.

TARGET: 3M Co. /Western Region Pharmaceutical Business/ 
BUYER: GTCR Golder Rauner LLC / Graceway Pharmaceuticals LLC 
SELLER: 3M Co.



LAST UPDATE: May 24, 2012 
ANNOUNCE DATE: November 9, 2006 
EFFECTIVE DATE: December 29, 2006



DEAL NO.: 398029


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture. Leveraged buyout.

Transaction Type:

Divestiture - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

December 29, 2006

Deal Description:

Graceway Pharmaceuticals Inc, headquartered in Bristol, Texas, acquired the assets and activities of 3M's pharmaceutical business in the United States, Canada and Latin America region for US$875 million. Alongside this transaction, 3M is also divesting its pharmaceutical business in Europe to Meda AB for US$857 million and its Asia Pacific pharmaceutical business to private equity firms Ironbridge Capital and Archer Capital for US$349 million. In 2005, 3M's Health Care business recorded net sales of US$3.76 billion and operating income of US$1.114 billion.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

$875,000,000

Closing Offer Price:

$875,000,000

Terms:

TARGET: Treo Solutions LLC 
BUYER: 3M Co. 
SELLER: Treo Solutions LLC



LAST UPDATE: April 3, 2014 
ANNOUNCE DATE: February 21, 2014 
EFFECTIVE DATE: April 1, 2014



DEAL NO.: 780174


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

April 1, 2014

Deal Description:

3M Co acquired Treo Solutions LLC for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition expands healthcare analytics product line of 3M Co. As part of the transaction, Treo Solutions LLC integrated into 3M Health Information Systems, a division of 3M Health Care, which is ultimately owned by 3M Co. The transaction was subject to customary closing conditions including, regulatory approvals. Treo Solutions LLC is located in Troy, New York, United States and develops healthcare information management software and solutions. Treo Solutions LLC has approximately 185 employees. The deal was originally expected to close in the second quarter of 2014.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

May 5, 2014

Deal Description:

LSI Industries Inc acquired 3M Digital Signage Inc, a subsidiary of 3M Co, for an undisclosed amount. The transaction enhances LSI Industries Inc's portfolio of digital signage software solutions offerings. The transaction is expected to be accretive to the profit margins of LSI Industries Inc. 3M Digital Signage Inc is located in Bainbridge Island, Washington, United States and develops software and hardware systems for digital signage networks.

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

July 7, 2003

The acquisition represents a strategic addition to 3M Health Care Ltd (UK)'s business and will help to promote efficient budgeting processes and reduce healthcare service costs for its clients.

TARGET: 3M Co. /Opticom Priority Control Systems & Canoga Traffic Bus/

SELLER: 3M Co.



LAST UPDATE: March 19, 2008 
ANNOUNCE DATE: June 28, 2007 
EFFECTIVE DATE: June 28, 2007



DEAL NO.: 428640


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture Unit Management. Leveraged buyout.

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Financial

Closing Date:

June 28, 2007

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Global Traffic Technologies LLC, a company formed by the senior management of Canoga Traffic Detection and Opticom Priority Control Systems, acquired the 3M Co Opticom Priority Control Systems and Canoga Traffic Detection businesses for $80US million in cash. Global Traffic Technologies LLC received backing from Torquest Partners Inc. 3M Co will continue to grow its Traffic Safety Systems Division business globally by providing advanced technologies to enhance roadway safety, efficiency and traffic management through signing, pavement marking, vehicle registration and intelligent transportation solutions.

100.000%

TARGET: Wendt (India) Ltd. 
BUYER: 3M Co. / 3M (Schweiz) AG 
SELLER: Wendt (India) Ltd.



LAST UPDATE: July 10, 2014 
ANNOUNCE DATE: June 3, 2011



DEAL NO.: 588899


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition Tender Offer

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Attitude:

Neutral

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

3M (Schweiz) AG, a subsidiary of 3M Co, will launch an offer to acquire an additional 20% stake in WENDT India Ltd for INR546.5 million (US$12.2 million) in cash. Under the terms of the offer, the bidder will pay INR1,366.3 (US$30.5) cash per share. The transaction is a mandatory offer pursuant through the acquisition by the bidder of an indirect 39.9% stake in the target through its acquisition of Winterthur Technologie AG. The offer is not subject to a minimum level of acceptance but is subject to approval from the Reserve Bank of India. The offer is scheduled to open on July 27, 2011 and close on August 16, 2011. WENDT India Ltd, based in India, manufactures grinding tools. On August 19, 2011, WENDT India Ltd has informed that the timetable for the open offer as mentioned in the PA would stand revised and a new schedule of activities would be notified to shareholders upon the receipt of SEBI observations.

Transaction Notes:

BE=INR1,366.34 cash per share * 400,000 Wendt India Ltd shares sought

Premium Offered:

.139

Percent Owned Before:

39.870%

Percent Sought:

20.000%

$30.495298

$12,198,000

Price/Earnings:

16.225

4.476

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

$12,198,119

$12,198,000

$12,198,119

Mergerstat M & A Database



TARGET: Ivera Medical Corp. 
BUYER: 3M Co. 
SELLER: Ivera Medical Corp.



LAST UPDATE: March 27, 2015 
ANNOUNCE DATE: February 19, 2015 
EFFECTIVE DATE: March 13, 2015



DEAL NO.: 818011


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

March 13, 2015

Deal Description:

3M Co acquired Ivera Medical Corp, also trading as Curos for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition would enhance product portfolio offerings of 3M Co in health care products and services industry and also expand its customer base internationally. The transaction complements 3M Co's vascular access products business. Following the transaction, Ivera Medical Corp would operate under 3M Co's Critical & Chronic Care Solutions division. The transaction was subject to customary closing conditions and regulatory approvals. Ivera Medical Corp is located in San Diego, California, United States and manufactures and markets infection control products to healthcare industry. The deal closed as originally expected in the first half of 2015. It has around 60 employees and generated annual revenues of approximately US$30 million.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

Ivera Medical Corp.

Country:

United States

Industry:

Drugs, Medical Supplies & Equipment

Description:

Manufactures and markets infection control products to healthcare industry


ANNUAL RESULTS

10K

  

(Millions US $)

12/31/2014

30.000

  

LATEST TWELVE MONTHS

Other

 

(Millions US $)

12/31/2014

  

Revenue

TARGET: 3M Co. /Library Systems Bus/ 
BUYER: OEP Capital Advisors LP 
SELLER: 3M Co.



LAST UPDATE: October 16, 2015 
ANNOUNCE DATE: October 6, 2015 
EFFECTIVE DATE: October 14, 2015



DEAL NO.: 843425


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture. Leveraged buyout.

Transaction Type:

Divestiture - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Financial

Closing Date:

October 14, 2015

Deal Description:

OEP Capital Advisors LP agreed to acquire the business and assets of Library Systems business from 3M Co, for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition will strengthen OEP Capital Advisors LP's investment portfolio in the education and library sector and also allow 3M Co to focus on its core business activities. Following the transaction, approximately 100 employees from the Library Systems business will join OEP Capital Advisors LP. The completion is subject to customary closing conditions. The Library Systems business provides circulation management solutions to libraries. As of October 6, 2015, OEP Capital Advisors LP has completed the acquisition of North American Library Systems business. The deal is expected to close in the fourth quarter of 2015.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

Exchange:

Provides circulation management solutions to libraries

TARGET: Racal Health & Safety Ltd 
BUYER: 3M Co. / 3M United Kingdom PLC 
SELLER: Racal Health & Safety Ltd



LAST UPDATE: January 26, 2004 
ANNOUNCE DATE: December 1, 1997 
EFFECTIVE DATE: December 1, 1997



DEAL NO.: 103533


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

December 1, 1997

Deal Description:

3M United Kingdom Plc, Bracknell, Berkshire, a subsidiary of 3M, (Minnesota Mining and Manufacturing Company), the US diversified international manufacturing company, acquired Racal Health & Safety Ltd, Bracknell, manufacturer of respiratory protection equipment, from Racal Electronics Plc, Bracknell, the voice and data communications group. The deal includes all of the worldwide respiratory and filtration businesses of Racal Health & Safety with the exception of the lightweight compressed air cylinder business of EFI Corporation and EFiC Ltd. Consideration £43.2m in cash. The proceeds will be used to reduce the companys net debt.

100.000%

TARGET: Acolyte Biomedica Ltd. 
BUYER: 3M Co. 
SELLER: Angle PLC



LAST UPDATE: January 17, 2008 
ANNOUNCE DATE: February 14, 2007 
EFFECTIVE DATE: February 20, 2007



DEAL NO.: 411106


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Conglomerate

Closing Date:

February 20, 2007

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

3M Co acquired Acolyte Biomedica Ltd, a subsidiary of Angle Plc, for up to GB£5.6 million ($10US.9 million) in cash. Under the terms of the agreement, 3M Co will pay an initial cash consideration of GB£0.9 million ($1US.7 million) and a deferred cash payment of up to GB£4.7 million ($9US.1 million) dependant upon certain conditions. Acolyte Biomedica Ltd develops, manufactures, and markets microbiology products. The acquisition expands 3M Co's business operations into the pharmaceutical market. Acolyte Biomedica Ltd reported revenues of GB£0.1 million ($0US.2 million), pre-tax loss of approximately GB£1.6 million ($3US.1 million), and net assets of approximately GB£0.3 million ($0US.6 million) at, and for the fiscal year ending on 31 December 2006.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

$10,981,000

Closing Offer Price:

$10,981,000

Available

Cash

Cash Payment:

$1,764,855

Total Invested Capital:

$10,981,000

$10,981,000

TARGET: Powell LLC 
BUYER: 3M Co. 
SELLER: OS Partners LLC



LAST UPDATE: March 18, 2008 
ANNOUNCE DATE: April 24, 2007 
EFFECTIVE DATE: May 1, 2007



DEAL NO.: 419399


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

May 1, 2007

Deal Description:

3M Co acquired Powell LLC from OS Partners LLC for an undisclosed amount. In a separate but related transaction 3M Co acquired Innovative Paper Technologies LLC from OS Partners LLC for an undisclosed amount. Innovative Paper Technologies LLC is a manufacturer of inorganic-based technical papers, boards and laminates for a wide variety of high temperature applications. Powell LLC is a supplier of non-woven polyester mats for the electrical industry. With this acquisition, 3M Co can enter into the adjacent market of flexible insulation materials, which are used for electrical insulation and thermal transfer applications, serving key customer segments such as motor manufacturers, transformer manufacturers, appliance original equipment manufacturers (OEMs) and wire and cable manufacturers. Both companies employ about 90 people.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

Powell LLC

Country:

United States

Industry:

Plastics & Rubber

Description:

Supplies non woven polyester mats for the US electrical industry

DEAL NO.: 255752


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

December 31, 2003

Deal Description:

3M Co acquired the remaining 49% stake in Pouyet Communication India Pvt Ltd for an undisclosed amount. The other 51% stake in the target company is owned by Societe Henri Pouyet of France, which is a subsidiary of 3M. By taking Pouyet Communications as a wholly owned company, 3M would be able to ensure a greater growth for its manufacturing initiatives in the Asia-Pacific region.

Percent Owned Before:

51.000%

Percent Sought:

49.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

December 9, 2008

Deal Description:

3M Co acquired ABRASIVOS SA for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition of the company brings to 3M Co a line of abrasives technologies and products and complements with 3M's abrasives technologies and established brands. ABRASIVOS SA manufactures coated abrasives. It is based in Lima, Peru.

Copyright 2010 FactSet Mergerstat, LLC 
Mergerstat M & A Database



TARGET: A-One Co. Ltd. 
BUYER: 3M Co. 
SELLER: A-One Co. Ltd.



LAST UPDATE: April 8, 2010 
ANNOUNCE DATE: February 22, 2010 
EFFECTIVE DATE: April 6, 2010



DEAL NO.: 537129


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

April 6, 2010

Deal Description:

3M Co acquired an 80% majority stake in A-One Co Ltd for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition of A-One Co Ltd would accelerate 3M Co's growth in the office and consumer label market and provide valuable technical expertise. Moreover, A-One Co Ltd wiould significantly enhance 3M Co's ability to create a global label platform that services its customers and delights its end-users. The deal, expected to close in the second quarter, was subject to customary closing conditions including necessary regulatory approvals. Based in Tokyo, Japan and founded in 1959, A-One Co Ltd is an office and consumer label products manufacturer in Japan. It is majority owned by the Arai family and is led by Hiroaki Arai who will still continue as President of the company after the acquisition.

Percent Sought:

80.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

TARGET: MTI PolyFab, Inc. 
BUYER: 3M Co. 
SELLER: MTI Global, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: June 11, 2010 
ANNOUNCE DATE: March 8, 2010 
EFFECTIVE DATE: June 11, 2010



DEAL NO.: 538523


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

June 11, 2010

Deal Description:

3M Co acquired MTI PolyFab Inc from MTI Global Inc for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition of MTI PolyFab complements and builds on 3M thermal acoustic and vibration damping portfolio for aircraft manufacturers and allows the company to expand into adjacent aerospace segments. MTI PolyFab products have been combined with 3M's subsidiary, Aearo Technologies Inc. MTI PolyFab Inc manufactures thermal and acoustic insulation from flexible, cellular materials for the aerospace industry. The company employs approximately 130 people and has operations in Canada, Brazil and Germany.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

July 8, 1999

Deal Description:

Smith & Nephew PLC acquired the Orthopaedic Implants Business of 3M for an undisclosed amount. The move was done as a part of 3Ms strategy of divesting all non-core businesses. One result of the deal will be the closure of the factory in Lowton Way in Hellaby, which employs 79 people.

TARGET: Incavas Industria de Cabos e Vassouras Ltda. 
BUYER: 3M Co. 
SELLER: Incavas Industria de Cabos e Vassouras Ltda.



LAST UPDATE: October 23, 2012 
ANNOUNCE DATE: December 15, 2009 
EFFECTIVE DATE: March 31, 2010



DEAL NO.: 530643


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

March 31, 2010

Deal Description:

3M Co acquired Incavas Industria de Cabos e Vassouras Ltda for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition will complement 3M Co's line of household cleaning tools and help establish its Home Care Division as a strong player in Brazil. The combination of 3M Co and Incavas Industria de Cabos e Vassouras Ltda will bring strong technical, sales and manufacturing synergies. The transaction closed as originally expected on March 31,2012. The transaction was subject to customary closing conditions. Incavas Industria de Cabos e Vassouras Ltda is a family-owned company founded in 1973 with an approximate workforce of 150 staff. It manufactures and sells household floor cleaning tools. It is based in Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

Manufactures and sells household floor cleaning tools and products

TARGET: 3M Co. /Subsidiaries (2)/ 
BUYER: The Orvis Co., Inc. 
SELLER: 3M Co.



LAST UPDATE: January 9, 2014 
ANNOUNCE DATE: May 1, 2013 
EFFECTIVE DATE: June 30, 2013



DEAL NO.: 753962


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

June 30, 2013

Deal Description:

The Orvis Co Inc acquired the business and assets of two fly fishing operations from 3M Co for an undisclosed amount. The transaction includes 100% acquisition of Ross Outdoor Sports Specialties LLC and Scientific Anglers. The transaction would enhance the service offerings of The Orvis Co Inc. Following the acquisition, Jim Lepage, vice president of The Orvis Co Inc, would serve as president of Ross Outdoor Sports Specialties LLC and Scientific Anglers. Ross Outdoor Sports Specialties LLC and Scientific Anglers would continue to operate independently. The transaction was originally expected to close in the second quarter of 2013. The acquired operations are located in the United States and manufactures fly fishing products.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

TARGET: 3M Co. /Infusion Therapy Business/ 
BUYER: Graseby PLC 
SELLER: 3M Co.



LAST UPDATE: February 10, 2014 
ANNOUNCE DATE: April 17, 1996 
EFFECTIVE DATE: July 31, 1996



DEAL NO.: 93022


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

July 31, 1996

Source of Funds:

Cash, Bank Debt

Deal Description:

Graseby Plc acquired the infusion therapy business of 3M Co for US$23 million in cash. The balance of the consideration, which would also reflect any post-closing adjustments, was paid in stages over a period of some three years. The acquisition was financed by Graseby Plc out of existing cash resources and bank borrowings. The acquisition enabled Graseby Plc to expand its existing product range in the United States region. The deal was subject to customary closing conditions including completion of due diligence by Graseby Plc, negotiation and execution of agreements, approval of the board of directors and shareholders of both companies, was expected to be completed in late June 1996. The acquired operations manufactures and distributes infusion therapy products.

Transaction Notes:

(CPN: /M BYXLE)

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Original Offer Price:

$22,650,000

Closing Offer Price:

$22,650,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

$22,650,000

Total Invested Capital:

$22,650,000

Base Equity Price:

$22,650,000

TARGET: 3m Co. /Static Control Business/ 
BUYER: Desco Industries, Inc. 
SELLER: 3M Co.



LAST UPDATE: January 5, 2015 
ANNOUNCE DATE: December 15, 2014 
EFFECTIVE DATE: January 2, 2015



DEAL NO.: 811067


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

January 2, 2015

Deal Description:

Desco Industries Inc acquired the business and assets of static control business from 3M Co, for an undisclosed amount. The transaction allows Desco Industries Inc to expand its footprint in the growing ESD industry. Following the acquisition, the 150 employees of the static control business would join Desco Industries Inc. The transaction was subject to customary closing conditions. The business is based in United States and manufactures and distributes ESD products and systems. It had generated sales of US$45 million and has 150 employees. The deal closed as originally expected during first quarter of 2015.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

TARGET: SlipNaxos Rappold France SAS 
BUYER: 3M Co. 
SELLER: SlipNaxos Rappold France SAS



LAST UPDATE: July 9, 2015 
ANNOUNCE DATE: January 31, 2015 
EFFECTIVE DATE: January 31, 2015



DEAL NO.: 833490


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

January 31, 2015

Deal Description:

3M Co acquired the remaining stake not already owned in SlipNaxos Rappold France SAS for EUR2 million (US$2.3 million). The transaction enhances 3M Co's product offerings. Following the transaction, 3M Co increases its stake in SlipNaxos Rappold France SAS to 100%. SlipNaxos Rappold France SAS is located in Lyon, Rhone-Alpes, France and distributes grinding wheels and abrasive products.

TARGET: Capital Safety Group Ltd. 
BUYER: 3M Co. 
SELLER: KKR Holdings LP



LAST UPDATE: September 23, 2015 
ANNOUNCE DATE: June 23, 2015 
EFFECTIVE DATE: August 3, 2015



DEAL NO.: 831550


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

August 3, 2015

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

3M Co acquired Capital Safety Group Ltd from Kohlberg Kravis Roberts & Co LP for an enterprise value of GBP1.6 billion (US$2.5 billion) in cash and assumed debt. Under the terms of the transaction, 3M Co paid GBP1.1 billion (US$1.8 billion) in cash and assume approximately GBP442.5 million (US$700 million) of debt. The deal would be financed through 3M Co's existing cash resources. The acquisition would further enhance the bidder's personal safety platform. Located in Milton Keynes, Buckinghamshire, United Kingdom, Capital Safety Group Ltd designs and manufactures height safety and fall protection equipment. For the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015, the company generates sales of approximately GBP289.7 million (US$430 million). The deal was subject to customary closing conditions and regulatory approvals and was originally expected to close by in the third quarter of 2015.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Closing Offer Price:

$1,789,759,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$1,789,758,505

Liabilities Assumed:

$696,017,170

Total Invested Capital:

$2,485,776,000

Base Equity Price:

$1,789,758,505

TARGET: Faab Fabricauto SA 
BUYER: Hills Numberplates Ltd. 
SELLER: 3M Co.



LAST UPDATE: December 9, 2015 
ANNOUNCE DATE: October 6, 2015 
EFFECTIVE DATE: December 1, 2015



DEAL NO.: 843346


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

December 1, 2015

Deal Description:

Hills Numberplates Ltd acquired Faab Fabricauto SA, from 3M France, a subsidiary of 3M Co, for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition would expand Hills Numberplates Ltd's market presence in France and United Kingdome and also allow 3M France to focus on its core business. Following the transaction, all the employees of Faab Fabricauto SA would join Hills Numberplates Ltd. The transaction was subject to consultation requirements with the relevant French Works Councils. Founded in 1999, Faab Fabricauto SA is located in Viriat, Rhone-Alpes, France and manufactures license plates and provides screen printing processes and digital printing. It has around 150 employees and generated annual revenues of approximately EUR26.7 million (US$30 million). The deal was originally expected to close during the fourth quarter of 2015.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

Name:

Country:

Exchange:

Description:

Manufactures license plates and provides screen printing processes and digital printing

TARGET: Hornell International AB 
BUYER: 3M Co. 
SELLER: Hornell International AB



LAST UPDATE: March 2, 2004 
ANNOUNCE DATE: January 12, 2004 
EFFECTIVE DATE: March 2, 2004



DEAL NO.: 249022


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

March 2, 2004

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

3M Co acquired Hornell International AB for approximately $100 million in cash. The transaction includes the assumption of debt and is subject to regulatory approval. Combining the strong products and technology for eye, face and respiratory protection in welding application of Hornell with the full spectrum of health and safety products of 3M enhances the business of 3M and will accelerate its growth in the global safety market.

100.000%

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Conglomerate

Closing Date:

October 16, 2006

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

3M Co acquired Brontes Technologies Inc for US$95 million in cash. Through this acquisition, 3M Co gains technology that enables capturing 3-D digital dental impressions used to design and produce crowns, bridges, and orthodontic appliances. Headquartered in St. Paul, Minnesota, 3M Co is one of the world's largest suppliers to the dental industry with its wide range of products.

Deal Type:

Divestiture Minority Interest

Transaction Type:

Purpose:

3M Co has acquired a 13% equity stake in Response Biomedical Corp for approximately CAD9.2 million (US$8.0 million). 3M Co has acquired 14.8 million shares of Response Biomedical Corp. This minority stake was made in pursuit of 3M Co developing and commercializing diagnostic products targeting hospital and community acquired infectious diseases using Response Biomedical Corp's RAMP testing platform.

TARGET: Bondo Corp. 
BUYER: 3M Co. 
SELLER: RPM International, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: December 27, 2007 
ANNOUNCE DATE: November 6, 2007 
EFFECTIVE DATE: November 9, 2007



DEAL NO.: 446240


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

November 9, 2007

Deal Description:

3M Co acquired Bondo Corp from RPM International Inc for an undisclosed amount. Based in Atlanta, Georgia, Bondo Corp manufactures and markets automotive body repair, household repair and marine products under various brand names. Its products are distributed through mass merchandisers, automotive parts retailers and jobbers. 3M Co will make Bondo part of its automotive Aftermarket Division.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

July 6, 2006

Deal Description:

HighJump Software Inc, a subsidiary of 3M Co, acquired Pinnacle Distribution Concepts Inc for an undisclosed sum. Pinnacle makes distribution and logistics management products, such as its web-based FreightLogic Program. 3M expects the acquisition to increase HighJump's reach in the transportation market.

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

July 1, 2008

Deal Description:

3M Co acquired Australia-based automotive repair and refinish products manufacturer, K&H Surface Technologies Pty Ltd, for an undisclosed amount. Based in Victoria, the target specializes in a range of automotive repair products for the professional and do-it-yourself automotive refinish markets. 3M believes the target's product offering will complement with the group's full-line of auto body repair products for the automotive aftermarket.

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

October 2, 2008

Deal Description:

3M Co acquired the entire share capital of SAPO SA for an undisclosed amount. Concurrent to the deal 3M Co also acquired EMFI SA. Both EMFI SA and SAPO SA are French manufacturers of polyurethane-based structural adhesives and sealants. EMFI SA and SAPO SA employ approximately 350 personnel.

Mergerstat M & A Database



TARGET: Viscoplast SA 
BUYER: Minnesota Mining & Manufacturing Co. / 3M Poland 
SELLER: Viscoplast SA



LAST UPDATE: November 13, 2008 
ANNOUNCE DATE: September 28, 2001 
EFFECTIVE DATE: December 27, 2001



DEAL NO.: 158015


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

December 27, 2001

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

3M Poland, a subsidiary of the Minnesota Mining and Manufacturing Company, St Paul, Minnesota, US, a mining and medical equipment conglomerate, made an offer for 1,956,500 shares, representing 100% of Viscoplast SA, for approximately GB£9.7 million (US$14.2 million) in cash, based on GB£4.95 (US$7.27) per share. The target is primarily a manufacturer of medical adhesive products. The offer represents a 19% premium over Viscoplasts six month average. The bid runs from September 28th to October 11th and requires 3M obtaining at least 80% of the capital.

Transaction Notes:

BE= 1,956,500 (Viscoplast) o/s shares sought * GBP4.95 per share

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Share Price:

$7.197

Original Offer Price:

$14,229,000

Closing Offer Price:

$14,081,000

Price/Earnings:

2.105

Multiple of Book Value:

0.201

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$14,081,130

Total Invested Capital:

$16,742,000

Base Equity Price:

$14,081,000


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

Viscoplast SA

Industry:

Instruments & Photographic Equipment

Description:

Manufactures medical adhesive products


ANNUAL RESULTS

TARGET: Grafoplast SpA 
BUYER: 3M Co. 
SELLER: Grafoplast SpA



LAST UPDATE: December 19, 2008 
ANNOUNCE DATE: November 12, 2008 
EFFECTIVE DATE: November 25, 2008



DEAL NO.: 496906


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

November 25, 2008

Deal Description:

3M Co acquired 100% of Grafoplast SpA for an undisclosed amount. Grafoplasts range of electrical permanent marking products complements 3Ms existing range of tape marking system products and will help us to better serve the wire and cable markets. Together, 3M and Grafoplast will offer a complete marking system solution for our customers globally. Grafoplast SpA is based in Predosa, Italy, and specializes in manufacturing of wire identification systems for the wire and cable market. The company was founded in 1963 and employs staff of 90.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

Grafoplast SpA

Country:

Italy

Industry:

Electrical Equipment

Description:

Manufactures wire identification systems for the wire and cable market

TARGET: Aearo Technologies, Inc. 
BUYER: 3M Co. 
SELLER: Aearo Holding Corp.



LAST UPDATE: March 17, 2009 
ANNOUNCE DATE: November 15, 2007 
EFFECTIVE DATE: April 1, 2008



DEAL NO.: 447338


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

April 1, 2008

Deal Description:

3M Co acquired Aearo Technologies Inc, a subsidiary of Aearo Holding Corp, from Permira Advisers LLP for US$1.2 billion. Based in Indianapolis, Indiana, Aearo Technologies Inc manufactures and sells personal protection products. The acquisition will greatly expand 3M Co's occupational and environmental safety platform. It will gain hearing protection, eyewear, and fall protection products. Permira Advisers LLP acquired Aearo in February of 2006.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Closing Offer Price:

$1,200,000,000

Terms:

Available

Total Invested Capital:

$1,200,000,000

Base Equity Price:

$1,200,000,000

TARGET: CUNO, Inc. 
BUYER: 3M Co. 
SELLER: CUNO, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: May 21, 2009 
ANNOUNCE DATE: May 12, 2005 
EFFECTIVE DATE: August 2, 2005



DEAL NO.: 336834


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Public Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

August 2, 2005

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

3M Co acquired CUNO Inc for US$1.2 billion in cash, plus the assumption of US$60 million in existing debt. 3M Co will integrate CUNO Inc into its existing air filtration business to expand upon its product portfolio and global presence. CUNO Inc manufactures filtration products for the separation, clarification, and purification of fluids and gasses.

Transaction Notes:

BE=$72 cash offer x 17,199,923 CUNO o/s

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

July 6, 2010

Deal Description:

3M Co acquired Dailys Ltd for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition provides an opportunity for 3M Co to expand its protective apparel portfolio. Based in Cheshire, Dailys Ltd manufactures and distributes disposable protective clothing for industrial use. It has 26 employees.

TARGET: Arizant, Inc. 
BUYER: 3M Co. 
SELLER: Arizant Holdings, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: October 13, 2010 
ANNOUNCE DATE: September 9, 2010 
EFFECTIVE DATE: October 13, 2010



DEAL NO.: 558360


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

October 13, 2010

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

3M Co entered into a definitive agreement to acquire Arizant Inc, a subsidiary of Arizant Holdings Inc, for US$810 million in cash. The acquisition will expand 3M's infection prevention offerings and drive the company to international growth. Completion of the acquisition is subject to customary closing conditions and regulatory approvals and is expected to close during the fourth quarter. Based in Eden Prairie, Minnesota, Arizant Inc designs, manufactures and markets medical devices. It has approximately 375 employees and generated sales of approximately US$200 million for 2010. Arizant is majority-owned by Court Square Capital.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Original Offer Price:

$810,000,000

Closing Offer Price:

$810,000,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$810,000,000

Total Invested Capital:

$810,000,000

Base Equity Price:

$810,000,000

TARGET: Nida-Core Corp. 
BUYER: 3M Co. 
SELLER: Nida-Core Corp.



LAST UPDATE: January 5, 2011 
ANNOUNCE DATE: January 3, 2011 
EFFECTIVE DATE: January 3, 2011



DEAL NO.: 571195


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

January 3, 2011

Deal Description:

3M Co acquired Nida-Core Corp for an undisclosed amount. The purpose of the transaction is to allow 3M Co to expand on its composite and engineered materials product portfolio. Nida-Core Corp manufactures and distributes polymer and related products. Nida-Core Corp was founded in 1988 and employs 25 people. The transaction includes Nida-Core Corp's subsidiary Structiso SARL.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

Name:

Nida-Core Corp.

Country:

United States

Industry:

Description:

Manufactures and distributes polymer and related products

TARGET: Alpha Beta Enterprise Co., Ltd. /Tape Business/ 
BUYER: 3M Co. 
SELLER: Alpha Beta Enterprise Co. Ltd.



LAST UPDATE: February 4, 2011 
ANNOUNCE DATE: October 18, 2010 
EFFECTIVE DATE: February 2, 2011



DEAL NO.: 562600


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

February 2, 2011

Deal Description:

3M Co acquired the operation and assets of the tape business of Alpha Beta Enterprise Co Ltd for an undisclosed amount. The Alpha Beta Enterprise tape business employs around 290 people and is headquartered in Taipei. It is engaged in the manufacture of pressure sensitive tapes such as box sealing tape and masking tape. The acquisition increases 3M's manufacturing plant in the Asia Pacific region and expand its product line. The target became the bidder's IATD's Global Tapes and Adhesives (GTA) Business Unit.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

Alpha Beta Enterprise Co., Ltd. /Tape Business/

Country:

Taiwan

Industry:

Paper

Description:

Manufactures box sealing tape and masking tape

TARGET: HighJump Software, Inc.

SELLER: 3M Co.



LAST UPDATE: May 23, 2011 
ANNOUNCE DATE: May 9, 2008 
EFFECTIVE DATE: June 5, 2008



DEAL NO.: 473411


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture. Leveraged buyout.

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Financial

Closing Date:

June 5, 2008

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Battery Ventures, a technology venture capital and private equity firm, acquired HighJump Software Inc from 3M Co, for US$85 million in cash. HighJump Software Inc is a premier provider of flexible supply chain execution software and services. 3M Co is a recognized leader in research and development. The transaction will result in a stand-alone company focused on providing supply chain solutions to a global customer base.

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Transaction Type:

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

July 1, 2011

Deal Description:

3M Co acquired Advanced Chemistry & Technology Inc, a subsidiary of JZ International Ltd, itself a subsidiary of The Jordan Co, for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition expands 3M's adhesives business. Completion is expected in the third quarter of 2011 subject to customary closing conditions. Advanced Chemistry & Technology Inc, based in Garden Grove, California, manufactures aerospace sealants and adhesives. The company has 70 employees.

TARGET: GPI Groupe Gergonne SAS /DIY & Professional DIV (3)/ 
BUYER: 3M Co. 
SELLER: GPI Groupe Gergonne SAS



LAST UPDATE: October 3, 2011 
ANNOUNCE DATE: July 22, 2011 
EFFECTIVE DATE: October 3, 2011



DEAL NO.: 593933


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

October 3, 2011

Deal Description:

3M Co acquired GPI Groupe Gergonne SAS' do-it-yourself and professional business, which is comprised of GPI SAS, Plasto Adhésifs SAS and Dinac SAS, for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition is part of 3M's expansion strategy. The deal does not include GPI Gregonne's industrial business, which will still remain under the group's ownership. The said businesses are involved in the production of adhesive tapes, insulation products and flooring protection products. The deal is subject to customary closing conditions and regulatory approvals. The deal is expected to close in the fourth quarter of 2011.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

LAST UPDATE: September 6, 2012

EFFECTIVE DATE: September 4, 2012



DEAL NO.: 724647


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

September 4, 2012

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

3M Co acquired Federal Signal Technologies LLC from Federal Signal Corp for US$110 million in cash. The acquisition augments 3M Co's motor vehicle system and service offerings. The transaction, expected to close in the second half of 2012, was pending customary closing conditions and regulatory approvals. Federal Signal Technologies LLC is based in Irvine, California, United States, and provides electronic toll collection and parking management hardware and software services. Additionally, Federal Signal Technologies LLC has around 500 employees.

TARGET: Avery Dennison Corp. /Office Consumer Products Ops/ 
BUYER: 3M Co. 
SELLER: Avery Dennison Corp.



LAST UPDATE: September 6, 2012 
ANNOUNCE DATE: January 3, 2012



DEAL NO.: 707222


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Horizontal

Cancelled Date:

September 4, 2012

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

3M Co withdrew its agreement to acquire the business and assets of Avery Dennison Corp's Office Consumer Products operations for US$550 million in cash. The acquisition would have complemented the portfolio of 3M Co. Additionally, Avery Dennison Corp would have use the proceeds to reduce debt, make additional pension contributions, and repurchase shares. The transaction was subject to customary closing conditions and regulatory approvals. Based in the United States, the Office Consumer products operations of Avery Dennison Corp distributes office supplies. The deal was expected to close in the second half of 2012.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Original Offer Price:

$550,000,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$550,000,000

Total Invested Capital:

$550,000,000

Base Equity Price:

$550,000,000

DEAL NO.: 819124


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

April 5, 2009

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

3M Co acquired Oiido AB, a portfolio company of Innovationsbron AB and GU Holding AB for SEK10 million (US$1.2 million) in cash. The acquisition was in line with the growth strategy of 3M Co. Oiido AB is located in Göteborg, Sweden and develops and sells headsets for communicating in noisy environments.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Closing Offer Price:

$1,245,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$1,245,346

Total Invested Capital:

$1,245,000

Base Equity Price:

TARGET: Large Format Graphics Business

LAST UPDATE: September 3, 1999

EFFECTIVE DATE: September 18, 1997



DEAL NO.: 24620


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

September 18, 1997

Deal Description:

3M acquired the Large-Format Graphics Business of Cactus, which will be changing its name and shifting from systems to OEM software sales. The deal also brings 3M ownership of the Cactus brand name and identity symbol, an exclusive license to the Cactus color management software and future rights.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

TARGET: Durel Corp 
BUYER: Rogers Corp 
SELLER: 3M Co.



LAST UPDATE: January 22, 2004 
ANNOUNCE DATE: September 30, 2003 
EFFECTIVE DATE: September 30, 2003



DEAL NO.: 223832


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

September 30, 2003

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Rogers Corp acquired the remaining 50% stake in Durel Corp from its joint venture partner, 3M Co, for approximately $26 million in cash. Durel is a 50/50 joint venture formed by Rogers and 3M in 1988 and it is now one of the largest manufacturers of electroluminescent lighting systems for automobiles, handheld devices, and sporting good products worldwide. From January 1, 2003 through August 31, 2003, Durel generated total revenues of approximately $44 million. Robert D Wachob, President and COO of Rogers, commented that the acquisition would add significant value to the company through leveraging its research and development capabilities to bring about future products to the automotive and wireless phone markets. As a result of the transaction, Durel would be integrated and consolidated into a new business unit of Rogers called the Durel Division and the financial and operating results would be included as part of the Polymer Materials and Components business segment.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Original Offer Price:

$26,000,000

Closing Offer Price:

$26,000,000

Price/Earnings:

1.965

Multiple of Book Value:

0.775

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$26,000,000

Total Invested Capital:

$26,000,000

Base Equity Price:

$26,000,000


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

Durel Corp

Country:

United States

Industry:

Electrical Equipment

Description:

Manufactures electroluminescent lighting systems for automobiles, handheld devices, and sporting good products

TARGET: HighJump Software, Inc. 
BUYER: 3M Co. 
SELLER: HighJump Software, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: March 2, 2004 
ANNOUNCE DATE: January 5, 2004 
EFFECTIVE DATE: February 2, 2004



DEAL NO.: 247132


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Conglomerate

Closing Date:

February 2, 2004

Deal Description:

3M Co acquired HighJump Software Inc for an undisclosed amount. HighJump Software provides supply chain execution software and solutions, including related trademarks and patents. Its products include solutions for warehouse and yard management, transportation management, supply chain visibility and event management, trading partner collaboration, and data collection. The solutions deliver a competitive advantage to manufacturers, distributors, retailers, and third-party logistics companies. Its supply chain execution systems are used at more than 700 companies. The acquisition will expand the existing service and solutions business of 3M.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

Country:

United States

Industry:

Internet; Computer Software, Supplies & Services

Description:

Develops supply chain execution solutions software

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

December 13, 2002

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

3M Co acquired Corning Precision Lens Inc from Corning Inc for $850 million in cash. This transaction affirms the strategy by 3M of accessing fast-growing markets by acquiring companies with strong market positions and technologies that it can leverage with its own strengths to drive faster long-term growth.

TARGET: Credence Technologies, Inc. 
BUYER: 3M Co. 
SELLER: Credence Technologies, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: September 11, 2006 
ANNOUNCE DATE: September 8, 2006 
EFFECTIVE DATE: September 8, 2006



DEAL NO.: 388464


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Vertical

Closing Date:

September 8, 2006

Deal Description:

3M Co acquired Credence Technologies Inc for an undisclosed amount. Credence Technologies Inc is a provider of instruments and monitoring equipment for electrostatic discharge control and electromagnetic compliance. Credence Technologies Inc employs approximately 12 people at its operations in Soquel, California. The addition of Credence Technologies Inc builds on 3M Co's previously announced acquisition of SCC Products Inc. and JJ Converting LLC, producers of flexible static control packaging and workstation products for electronic devices.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

Credence Technologies, Inc.

Country:

United States

Industry:

Instruments & Photographic Equipment

Description:

Provider of instrumentation for electrostatic discharge control and electromagnetic compliance

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

TARGET: Security Printing & Systems Ltd. 
BUYER: 3M Co. 
SELLER: authentos GmbH



LAST UPDATE: January 20, 2007 
ANNOUNCE DATE: July 18, 2006 
EFFECTIVE DATE: August 1, 2006



DEAL NO.: 381526


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

August 1, 2006

Deal Description:

US-based 3M Co acquired UK-based Security Printing & Systems Ltd from authentos GmbH for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition enables 3M Co to expand its product portfolio of secure documents, such as passports, ID cards, driver licenses and visas and to deliver a full range of border and civil security solutions products. Security Printing & Systems Ltd produces finished, personalized passports and secure cards and provides high security printing for public sector customers.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

Country:

United Kingdom

Industry:

Description:

Produces finished, personalized passports and secure cards and provides high security printing for public sector customers

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

February 9, 2007

Deal Description:

3M Co has acquired the 50% stake it did not own in Polymask Corp from Sealed Air Corp for an undisclosed amount. Polymask Corp, a joint venture formed in 1991, employs 105 people and produces protective films that guard various materials against scratching, marring, chipping, abrasion, and UV during production, packaging, shipping and installation. Polymask Corp will use 3M Co's technologies to expand more quickly into primary and adjacent markets.

Percent Owned Before:

50.000%

Percent Sought:

50.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

United States

DEAL NO.: 422456


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Conglomerate

Closing Date:

May 15, 2007

Deal Description:

3M Co acquired the business and assets of Artículos de Papel DMS Chile SA's medical supplies manufacturing operations for an undisclosed amount. Articulos de Papel manufactures medical supplies such as disposable surgical packs, drapes, gowns and kits. The company said the acquisition builds on 3M's core medical business and expands its line for infection prevention in Latin America.

LAST UPDATE: June 6, 2007

DEAL NO.: 425357


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

June 6, 2007

Deal Description:

3M Co acquired Diamond Productions Inc for an undisclosed amount. Diamond Productions, based in Wayne, New Jersey, is a manufacturer of superabrasive diamond and cubic boron nitride wheels and tools for dimensioning and finishing materials in metalworking, woodworking and stone fabrication markets. The addition of Diamond Productions metal, resin, and vitrified superabrasives will strengthen 3M's cutting and grinding capabilities.

TARGET: Robinson Nugent Inc 
BUYER: 3M Co. 
SELLER: Robinson Nugent Inc



LAST UPDATE: March 15, 2003 
ANNOUNCE DATE: October 3, 2000 
EFFECTIVE DATE: February 16, 2001



DEAL NO.: 53449


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Public Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

February 16, 2001

Source of Funds:

Vendor Placing

Deal Description:

Minnesota Mining & Manufacturing Co acquired Robinson Nugent Inc for approximately $124.8 million in stock, plus an undisclosed amount of assumed debt to add Internet router connectors to its interconnect business. The acquisition of Robinson broadens the Interconnect Solutions Division product base by providing higher speed copper interconnects, complements customer relationships, and supports the business strategy to expand further in the telecommunications sector. The transaction will be accounted for as purchase.

Transaction Notes:

BE=(5,917,583 RNIC o/s x .19 exchange ratio) x $110.97 MMM close on 2/15/01.

Equity Consideration:

$1,124,341

Premium Offered:

0.344

4.395

$137,738,000
