LAST UPDATE: March 4, 2008 
ANNOUNCE DATE: March 4, 2008 
EFFECTIVE DATE: March 4, 2008



DEAL NO.: 462776


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

March 4, 2008

Deal Description:

Dyneon LLC, a subsidiary of 3M Co, acquired HiTech Polymers Inc for an undisclosed amount. HiTech Polymers Inc is a manufacturer of specialty thermoplastics used to create a large range of plastic compounds. Similarly Dyneon LLC manufacturer of high-performance fluoroplastics used in sealing the most demanding of conditions. The merger allows for support in Dyneon LLC's core business and expansion into new markets providing access to new technologies and customers. HiTech Polymers Inc employs 15 people as well as a manufacturing facility in Hebron, Kentucky.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

HiTech Polymers, Inc.

Country:

United States

Industry:

Plastics & Rubber

Description:

Manufactures thermoplastic polymers and provides toll thermoplastic compounding services

Deal Type:

Transaction Type:

Purpose:

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

August 16, 2007

Deal Description:

3M Co, a diversified manufacturer, acquired certain assets of Neoplast Co Ltd, a Thailand-based manufacturer of skin and wound care products, for an undisclosed amount. Neoplast Co manufactures surgical tapes and dressing and first aid bandages for both the professional and consumer markets in the Asia Pacific Region. It employs about 700 people.

Horizontal

July 1, 2008

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

July 2, 2008

Deal Description:

3M Co, a recognized leader in research and development, acquired IMTEC Corp, a manufacturer of dental implants and cone beam computed tomography (CBCT) scanning equipment, for an undisclosed amount. IMTEC Corp is best known for its mini dental implants, which are small-diameter, single-unit dental implants.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

August 1, 2008

Deal Description:

3M Co acquired TOP-Service für Lingualtechnik GmbH for an undisclosed price. TOP-Service für Lingualtechnik GmbH is a Germany-based company that specializes in orthodontic technology and services. The company is best known for its invisible orthodontic solutions branded as Incognito and iBraces systems, which are bonded to the tongue side of teeth.

Deal Type:

Purpose:

Closing Date:

September 2, 2008

Deal Description:

3M Co acquired Ligacon AG for an undisclosed price. Ligacon AG is a Swiss business that specializes in the manufacture of filtration systems and relevant solutions for the filtration and separation of liquids and gases for the pharmaceutical, biotech and general industrial markets.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

Transaction Type:

Purpose:

October 2, 2008

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

February 9, 2009

Deal Description:

Venture Tape Corp, a subsidiary of 3M Co, acquired the pressure sensitive adhesive tape division of Compac Corp which is a subsidiary of LAMTEC Corp, for an undisclosed amount. Compac Corp's pressure sensitive tape products are used for the heating, ventilation and air conditioning, insulation and industrial markets

TARGET: Slat SAS 
BUYER: Slat SAS /Management/ 
SELLER: 3M Co.



LAST UPDATE: May 23, 2011 
ANNOUNCE DATE: July 1, 2009 
EFFECTIVE DATE: July 1, 2009



DEAL NO.: 516850


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture Unit Management. Leveraged buyout.

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Financial

Closing Date:

July 1, 2009

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Private group led by management of Slat SAS and backed by Initiative et Finance SA, a subsidiary of Natixis SA acquired Slat SAS from 3M Co for EUR3.6 million (US$5 million) in cash. Slat SAS is based near Lyon, France, and specializes in design, manufacturing, and distribution of transformers and power supplies. The company employs staff of 62 and in 2008 generated revenues of EUR12 million (US$17 million).

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Closing Offer Price:

$5,037,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$5,037,249

Total Invested Capital:

$5,037,000

Base Equity Price:

$5,037,249

TARGET: Solvay Fluoropolymers Inc 
BUYER: 3M Co. / Dyneon LLC 
SELLER: Solvay SA



LAST UPDATE: June 16, 2004 
ANNOUNCE DATE: August 27, 2002 
EFFECTIVE DATE: January 22, 2003



DEAL NO.: 177414


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

January 22, 2003

Deal Description:

Dyneon LLC, a wholly owned subsidiary of 3M Co, acquired Solvay Fluoropolymers Inc from Solvay SA for an undisclosed amount. Solvay Fluoropolymers Inc sells a line of polyvinylidene fluoride homopolymers and copolymers and has manufacturing facilities in Decatur, Alabama. As a result of the transaction, polyvinylidene fluoride fluoroplastic products formerly marketed under the Solef brand by Solvay Fluoropolymers Inc will now be marketed by Dyneon LLC under the Dyneon brand.

Transaction Notes:

Closed, RS.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Country:

United States

Description:

Provides a line of polyvinylidene fluoride homopolymers and copolymers

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition Tender Offer

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Public Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

February 15, 2001

Attitude:

Friendly

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Minnesota Mining & Manufacturing, through its subsidiary Equinox Acquisition, acquired MicroTouch Systems for $136.3 million in a cash tender offer for $21 per share. The acquisition expands its line of touch screens used in automated teller machines and kiosks.

Transaction Notes:

BE = $21.00 * 6,491,823 o/s. Closed, ST. (Src Fix-It: Cash)

.556

100.000%
